posts.post_content:
For you newer players, let me explain the power of this card.  
  
First turn - [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise) or [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves)  
Second turn - [Fires of Yavimaya](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fires of Yavimaya)  
Third Turn - [Blastoderm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blastoderm), attack for 5  
Fourth Turn - [Saproling Burst](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Saproling Burst), make 3 4/4's, attack with them and the Blastoderm. Even if the opponent has a blocker, he's going to block the Blastoderm, and he'll be at 3.   
  
*That means even if he did use something like [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God), he was dead to a lowly Lllanowar Elf next turn, because of the Fires of Yavimaya*  
  
I beat so many people at FNM's with that deck...it wasn't even fair. Let's not even talk about how unfair [Flametongue Kavu](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flametongue Kavu) was!
posts.html:
For you newer players, let me explain the power of this card.

First turn - Birds of Paradise or Llanowar Elves
Second turn - Fires of Yavimaya
Third Turn - Blastoderm, attack for 5
Fourth Turn - Saproling Burst, make 3 4/4's, attack with them and the Blastoderm. Even if the opponent has a blocker, he's going to block the Blastoderm, and he'll be at 3.

That means even if he did use something like Wrath of God, he was dead to a lowly Lllanowar Elf next turn, because of the Fires of Yavimaya

I beat so many people at FNM's with that deck...it wasn't even fair. Let's not even talk about how unfair Flametongue Kavu was!

posts.post_content: Fearsome thanks to [Fires of Yavimaya](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fires of Yavimaya) or [Pandemonium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pandemonium). Still, there's lots of potential for other combos. It can drop six tokens when you play it, which can be 12 mana with [Ashnod's Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashnod's Altar). [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus), anyone?

posts.post_content:
For the players on a budget, [Parallel Lives](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Parallel Lives) is a nice alternative to [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season) ( if you're playing casual or unlimited. )  
  
I have a modified Fires deck that I pair up with my friend's proliferate deck in two headed giant. Blastoderms that never go away, six 4/4 saprolings that only get bigger, it's a thing of beauty.

Posted By: RedJaron (12/7/2011 2:36:11 PM)

posts.post_content:
Saproling Burst is usually used as a combo card with Fires of Yavimaya. A turn one Birds of Paradise followed by a T2 Fires of Yavimaya allowed a T3 5/5 Shroud Haste via Blastoderm.  
This combo, if followed up by a T4 Saproling Burst, usually spelled doom to Standard players circa 2000-2001 season.  
This strategy was developed by Magic Hall Of Fame player Zvi Moshowitz.
posts.html:
Saproling Burst is usually used as a combo card with Fires of Yavimaya. A turn one Birds of Paradise followed by a T2 Fires of Yavimaya allowed a T3 5/5 Shroud Haste via Blastoderm.
This combo, if followed up by a T4 Saproling Burst, usually spelled doom to Standard players circa 2000-2001 season.
This strategy was developed by Magic Hall Of Fame player Zvi Moshowitz.
